page.title: 17DENWICK (PETER'S) MILL
page.content: {Denwick Mill,}was established about { {1680}as a{fulling mill.}This was a process for the cleaning of raw wool and the mill continued to be used for this purpose for 159 years.In{1848 {Peter Eadington}changed the use of the mill to{corn grinding.}From then on the mill has been known as{Peter's {Mill.}He got the grindstones from Billy Mill,Chirton,South Shields and one of these is now embedded in a wall of{Waterside House Farm.}In 1897 the tenancy passed to Anne and Mary Eadington and early this century the mill ceased to function. Mary died during the 1st World war and in 1926 Sir Francis Walker ordered Brannigan to remove the mill and the house.The area is still known as Peter's Mill and is a{favourite spot for local {people to go walking.Stepping stones {have replaced an earlier bridge.
